newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia Yield Spreads-Curve flattens more on RBA.
newsitem.headline: Australia Yield Spreads-Curve flattens more on RBA.

text.p: The Australian bond yield curve's recent flattening trend accelerated on Thursday after Reserve Bank governor Ian Macfarlane ruled out a further easing in monetary policy.

In his first semi-annual testimony to parliament Macfarlane said there would be no economic gain from another cut, and even warned of pre-emptive tightening if the already uncomfortably high level of wages growth expanded further.
The three/10-year bond futures spread has now widened some 20 basis points in under two weeks to stand at its lowest level since late March.
Against other dollar bloc bonds the market was fairly mixed, narrowing against the long-end of both Canada and the U.S. which both saw poor responses to 10-year bond auctions on Wednesday.
